alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 24 at 7:13PM EDT until August 24 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Forsyth County in central North Carolina... Davidson County in central North Carolina... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 713 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Winston-Salem to near Lexington to Granite Quarry, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, High Point, Lexington, Thomasville, Linwood, Denton, Gordontown, High Rock Lake, Newsom and Arcadia. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
